alert.note: Alert for Halifax; Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 8:23PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Virginia, including the following counties, Halifax and Pittsylvania. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 823 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bradley Creek, Buffalo Creek, Armistead Branch, Catawba Creek, Banister River, Allen Creek, Bird Creek and Bull Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gretna... Brookneal... Mt Airy... Straightstone... Cody... Chalk Level... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
